Uses of Interface
javafx.concurrent.Worker

  • Packages that use Worker 
    Package Description
    javafx.concurrent
    Provides the set of classes for javafx.task.
    javafx.scene.web
    This package provides means for loading and displaying Web content.

    • Uses of Worker in javafx.concurrent

      Classes in javafx.concurrent that implement Worker 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ScheduledService<V>
      The ScheduledService is a Service which will automatically restart itself after a successful execution, and under some conditions will restart even in case of failure.
      class  Service<V>
      A Service is a non-visual component encapsulating the information required to perform some work on one or more background threads.
      class  Task<V>
      A fully observable implementation of a FutureTask.
      Methods in javafx.concurrent that return Worker 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Worker WorkerStateEvent.getSource()
      The Worker on which the Event initially occurred.
      Constructors in javafx.concurrent with parameters of type Worker 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkerStateEvent(Worker worker, EventType<? extends WorkerStateEvent> eventType)
      Create a new WorkerStateEvent.

    • Uses of Worker in javafx.scene.web

      Methods in javafx.scene.web that return Worker 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Worker<Void> WebEngine.getLoadWorker()
      Returns a Worker object that can be used to track loading progress.
